message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.SD

Reasoning: 
1. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a modified algorithm for Blind Signal Separation (BSS) problems using stochastic optimization methods. This falls under the domain of machine learning, specifically unsupervised learning.
2. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): The proposed approach is based on the Adaptive Moment Estimation (Adam) algorithm, which is a popular optimization algorithm used in neural networks. This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-category of neural and evolutionary computing.
3. cs.SI (Signal Processing): Blind Signal Separation (BSS) is a signal processing technique used to separate mixed signals into their individual components. This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-category of signal processing.
4. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper discusses the derivation of the cost function maximization in the standard InfoMax algorithm, which is based on information theory. This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-category of information theory.
5. cs.SD (Sound): Blind Signal Separation (BSS) is commonly used in audio signal processing to separate mixed audio signals into their individual components. This suggests that the paper may fall under the sub-category of sound.
